content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content: Example Output a string with the PHP syntax highlighted: "); ?> The browser output of the code above will be: Hello world! The HTML output of the code above will be (View Source): Hello world!  <?php phpinfo ();  ?> Definition and Usage The highlight_string() function outputs a string with the PHP syntax highlighted. The string is highlighted by using HTML tags. The colors used for syntax highlighting can be set in the php.ini file or with the ini_set() function. Syntax highlight_string( string,return ) Parameter Values Parameter Description string Required. Specifies the string to be highlighted return Optional. If set to TRUE, this function will return the highlighted code as a string, instead of printing it out. Default is FALSE Technical Details Return Value: Returns TRUE on success, or FALSE on failure PHP Version: 4+ Changelog: The return parameter was added in PHP 4.2.0 ★ +1
